scrapeType.title: Scrape Type
scrapeType.description: Type of LinkedIn content to scrape

urls.title: LinkedIn URLs
urls.description: List of LinkedIn URLs to scrape (profile, company, or job URLs)

email.title: LinkedIn Email
email.description: Email address for LinkedIn login (required if cookie not provided)

password.title: LinkedIn Password
password.description: Password for LinkedIn login (required if cookie not provided)

cookie.title: LinkedIn Cookie (li_at)
cookie.description: LinkedIn 'li_at' cookie value for authentication (alternative to email/password)

proxyConfiguration.title: Proxy configuration
proxyConfiguration.description:
Specifies proxy servers that will be used by the scraper to hide its origin and avoid detection.

For production use, we strongly recommend using proxies to prevent IP blocks.

proxyRotation.title: Proxy rotation
proxyRotation.description: This property indicates the strategy of proxy rotation and can only be used in conjunction with Apify Proxy. The recommended setting automatically picks the best proxies from your available pool and rotates them evenly, discarding proxies that become blocked or unresponsive. IMPORTANT: This setting will only use your available Apify Proxy pool.

sessionPoolName.title: Session pool name
sessionPoolName.description: Use only english alphanumeric characters, dashes and underscores. A session is a representation of a user with its own IP and cookies. By providing a session pool name, you enable sharing of those sessions across multiple Actor runs. This is very useful for LinkedIn as it helps maintain login state and avoid re-authentication. Sessions expire after 24 hours unless used again.

headless.title: Headless Mode
headless.description: Run browser in headless mode (faster but might be detected easier)

getContacts.title: Get Contacts (Person only)
getContacts.description: Scrape the person's connections/contacts (only for person scraping)

getEmployees.title: Get Employees (Company only)
getEmployees.description: Scrape company employees (only for company scraping, may take longer)

jobSearchTerm.title: Job Search Term
jobSearchTerm.description: Search term for job search (only used when scrapeType is 'job_search')

maxResults.title: Max Results
maxResults.description: Maximum number of results to scrape
